body_html:
Hey!
Thanks a lot for your answer and the helpful information - good catch!
However, what I didn't get. If a OutOfRangeError occurs, then it should be catched outside of the with tf.MonitoredTrainingSession(...) and at least prints that an error occured - or am I wrong and missing something?

Hey!
Thanks a lot for your answer and the helpful information - good catch!
However, what I didn't get. If a OutOfRangeError occurs, then it should be catched outside of the with tf.MonitoredTrainingSession(...) and at least prints that an error occured - or am I wrong and missing something?
body:
Hey!
Thanks a lot for your answer and the helpful information - good catch!
However, what I didn't get. If a `OutOfRangeError` occurs, then it should be catched outside of the `with tf.MonitoredTrainingSession(...)` and at least prints that an error occured - or am I wrong and missing something?
